Protection.NameOfProject: Improving the lifes of vulnerable returnee- and host community households in Sinuni and Wana sub- districts through the provision of protection services and agricultural support (multi-cluster project)
Protection.Objective: The overall objective of the protection component is to expand general protection services (including legal assistance/counselling, PSS & HLP) to underserved areas with high needs in order to ensure safe and dignified returns and sustainable lives of people living in Arab villages and Neighboring villages in Sinuni Sub district, Sinjar districts.

ProtectionActivities.Activity: Protection Monitoring In Non Camps For Refugees Syrian And Non-Syrian
Protection Cases Recieved In Camps For Refugees

ProtectionHighlights.GeneralHighlights: CBP team shared 22 vulnerable cases whose ages ranged from 11-49 with UNHCR under their request for the purpose of providing dignity kits.

As one of the remote and home-based working, CBP team heard about the initiative of BCF (Barzani Charity Organization) on the media that they are planning to distribute and deliver some basic food items to families in need in Erbil, Sulaimany, Halabja and Duhok governorates. We contacted their hotline numbers in a hope to share a list of 32 vulnerable families which were identified this year. They responded that they receive no referrals and it will be only through phone calling by beneficiaries to their provided hotlines. As a result, we called the prepared and potential beneficiaries informing and advising them to contact BCF for such assistance.

As Harikar is working Home based, our CBP team is currently working on updating the service mapping through approaching service providers via telephone numbers. We are using last year template in a hope to update it soon. We have faced difficulties that some agencies are not responding to our calls which may delay us to finalize the list.
P.A.M for IDPs participated in CCCM cluster meeting at BRHA.

Due to the suspension of activities in the first two weeks of March, the work suspension by the government and not having transportation for the staff. Capacity building sessions were organized and each lawyer were asked to present a topic to the legal team. As a result, lawyers presented sessions on GBV, Mental health law, law and philosophy, Provincial Law, Parole and budget law.
One protection meeting was conducted in Essiyan Camp.
As part of regular work protection monitors have been working from home to follow up on issues in camps and provide weekly reports.

SGBVActivities.Activity: GBV Core concept and case management training for staff
Non- structured psycho-social support (PSS) activities for children and adolescents
Age- appropriate activities with a particular focus on adolescent engagement in community  projects
Girls and boys at risk identified and referred to specialized services
NON-GBV actors trained on GBV prevention and referral

SGBVHighlights.GeneralHighlights: Harikar's SGBV team conducted awareness sessions on Coronavirus via social media, and total of 7200(1836 women, 1535 girls, 2013 men, 1816 boys) members were reached.

APM for GBV has attended a meeting with Inter-Agency Humanitrain Evaluation global team on the gender equlaity and empowerment of women and girls in KR-I via Skype. The purpose behind this meeting was to dicuss the main concerns and gaps which women and girls have in KR-I and how to develop the programs for future.
APM for GBV has attended a meeting with Harikar and UNHCR concern staff on the reporting via Skype.
APM for GBV has attended GBVIMS monthly meeting via Skype.
On 5th March 2020, CPO has conducted basic information about the covid19 for CAC staff the main subjects of the seminar was on the prevention and transmission of coronavirus Covid-19
